StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Gene Mutation and Rescue in Human Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia (CDH)

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Whole exome sequencing funding was provided by NICHD P01HD068250-03 to Patricia K. Donahoe, MD. Additional sequencing services were provided through RS&G Service by the Northwest Genomics Center at the University of Washington, Department of Genome Sciences, under U.S. Federal Government contract number HHSN268201100037C from the NHLBI.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term:
Before data dissemination to a requestor, local IRB approval will be required to ensure that anonymity and other provisions are adequately guaranteed.
Requestors of data must establish a collaboration with Dr. Donahoe.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia, IRB, COL)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CDH-IRB-COL
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s).
A partial listing of related conditions includes: Bochdalek-type Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia; Morgagni-type Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia; Isolated Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia; Pulmonary hypoplasia; Persistent pulmonary hypertension of the newborn (PPHN); Atrial Septal Defect (ASD); Atrioventricular Septal Defect (or AV Canal Defect); Ventricular Septal Defect (VSD); Congenital Heart Defects.
Local IRB Approval and collaboration with the primary study investigators is required
